definitions.definition: a situation in which people, groups or countries disagree strongly or are involved in a serious argument
definitions.sensetop: conflict between A and B (over something)conflict with somebodyconflict over somethingin conflict with somebody (over something)conflict within something

examples.text: His task will be to resolve potential conflicts between the British and Scottish governments.

She found herself in conflict with her parents over her future career.
John often **comes into conflict** with his boss.
The terms of the will became a source of conflict within the family.
She has received training in **conflict resolution**.
His work brought him into conflict with more conventional scientists.
The conflict arose from different ambitions within the team.
The decision led to a bitter conflict between the management and unions.
There is more to a successful relationship than simply managing conflict.
They found themselves in conflict over the future of the company.
They hid their feelings to avoid conflict.

conflicts between different ethnic groups
in conflict with management
serious conflicts within the ruling party

definitions.sensetop: conflict with somebodyconflict over somethingconflict between A and B (over something)

examples.text: **armed/military conflict**

international efforts to find a peaceful **solution to the conflict**

examples.text: Thousands have been arrested in violent ethnic conflicts in the region.

definitions.definition: a situation in which there are ideas, opinions, feelings or wishes that are opposed to each other; a situation in which it is difficult to choose
definitions.sensetop: conflict between A and Bin conflict with somethingconflict of something

examples.text: Her diary was a record of her inner conflict.
The story tells of a classic conflict between love and duty.
Many of these ideas appear to be in conflict with each other.
He faced a conflict of loyalties.
a serious conflict of opinion
in direct conflict with his wishes
the conflict between science and religion
the inherent conflict between what farmers and environmentalists want
the inherent conflict between the demands of farmers and wishes of environmentalists

definitions.definition: a situation in which somebody has two jobs, aims, roles, etc. and cannot treat both of them equally and fairly at the same time

examples.text: There was a conflict of interest between his business dealings and his political activities.
One member of the planning committee had a conflict of interest as he lived near the proposed road.
There is often a conflict of interests between farmers and conservationists.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin conflict- ‘struck together, fought’, from the verb confligere, from con- ‘together’ + fligere ‘to strike’; the noun is via Latin conflictus ‘a contest’.
